FuncDef: The reset sr-te policy traffic-statistics command clears SR-MPLS TE Policy traffic statistics.
CLIs: reset sr-te policy traffic-statistics [ endpoint <ipv4-address> color <color-value> | policy-name <name-value> | binding-sid <binding-sid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the endpoint of an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the color value of an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies a binding SID.
The value is an integer ranging from 16 to 1048575.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset sr-te policy traffic-statistics endpoint 10.1.23.42 color 100
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
SR-MPLS TE Policies support traffic statistics collection. To clear existing SR-MPLS TE Policy traffic statistics, run the reset sr-te policy traffic-statistics command. The reset sr-te policy traffic-statistics and display sr-te policy traffic-statistics commands can be used together to help locate SR-MPLS TE Policy-related traffic forwarding problems.
